titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to clarify that expenses for blood storage qualify as expenses for medical care.
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to clarify that expenses for blood storage qualify as expenses for medical care.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: This bill expands the tax deduction for medical expenses to include expenses for storage of blood or biomaterial derived from blood.
